intro: Rhinanthus maximus, commonly known as the greater burnet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom from June to August. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and waste areas. It has hairy, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Rhinanthus maximus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
